author: Special Correspondent
text:
A conference of maxillofacial surgeons has called for raising awareness on early detection of oral cancer and road safety, which continue to be the two most important sources of trauma.

Over 250 maxillofacial surgeons participated in the fourth annual conference of The Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons of India-Tamil Nadu and Puducherry chapter hosted by the Indira Gandhi institute of Dental Sciences of Sri Balaji Vidyapeeth University.

The event focused on the prevention of cancer related deaths and trauma from road traffic accidents.

According to the organisers, the theme of the conference was chosen against the backdrop of rising incidence of oral cancer and the need for early detection to improve treatment outcomes as well as the increase in road traffic accidents resulting in disabilities and death.

The event featured guest speakers from abroad and from all over the country. The guest of honour was Dr. M.F. Baig, Dean of Research and Methodology, Saveetha Dental College. The conference recommended the need for awareness related to early detection of oral cancer and road safety in future.

title: Surgeons to raise awareness of early detection of oral cancer
